alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Monroe; Washington; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 09 at 12:55AM CST until January 09 at 1:45AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Monroe County in south central Alabama... Eastern Washington County in southwestern Alabama... Central Clarke County in southwestern Alabama... Southwestern Wilcox County in south central Alabama... * Until 145 AM CST. * At 1254 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Wagarville, or 11 miles southwest of Jackson, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Jackson, Thomasville, Grove Hill, Saint Stephens, Wagarville, Leroy, Whatley, Pine Hill, and Fulton. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CST for south central and southwestern Alabama.
